description: Bidirectional Transformer model for general-purpose NLP tasks such as sentiment analysis and topic classification.
limitations: not ideal for very long documents (>512 tokens)
not designed for text generation tasks
infra_requirements: GPU recommended for training. CPU inference is fine for low/medium load.
typical_users: Teams building supervised classifiers on short or medium-length text.

description: Smaller, faster version of BERT with good performance for many text classification tasks.
limitations: slightly lower accuracy than full BERT models
still not suitable for very long documents
infra_requirements: Can run on CPU for small workloads. GPU recommended for training.
typical_users: Teams needing a balance between speed and accuracy for text classification.

description: Encoder-decoder model that treats every NLP problem as a text-to-text task.
limitations: small variant may underperform on complex tasks
slower than encoder-only models for pure classification
infra_requirements: GPU recommended for training and heavier inference.
typical_users: Teams needing flexible sequence-to-sequence text generation.

description: Real-time object detection model that can detect multiple object classes in images and videos.
limitations: not suitable for OCR or document layout understanding
infra_requirements: GPU strongly recommended, especially for real-time use cases.
typical_users: Teams doing real-time detection in CV applications.

description: Gradient boosting library that is a strong baseline for many tabular data problems.
limitations: not designed for raw text, images, or audio
infra_requirements: Runs well on CPU for most moderate-sized datasets.
typical_users: Data science teams working with structured business data.

description: Additive model for time-series forecasting designed for business data with seasonality and holidays.
best_for: daily or weekly time series with strong seasonality
quick baseline forecasts with interpretable components
limitations: not ideal for high-frequency or very noisy time series
limited support for complex multivariate relationships
infra_requirements: CPU is sufficient for most use cases.
typical_users: Business analysts and data scientists forecasting KPIs.
